definition: to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: After the incident, Lee also directs others Perjury up their own misdeeds .
sentences.chinese: 事發後，李英還指使他人作僞證包庇自己的劣跡。

sentences.english: He had been punished for covering up for a friend.
sentences.chinese: 他因包庇友人曾受到處分。

sentences.english: Yang's family is pretending that he is mentally ill to protect him.
sentences.chinese: 她和丈夫說，楊家裝作兒子是精神病而包庇了他。

sentences.english: The shield of family and friends can easily used as a shelter by criminals for further crimes.
sentences.chinese: 包庇窩贓，很容易成爲犯罪分子繼續作惡的防空洞。

sentences.english: She and her husband say Mr. Yang’s family is pretending that he is mentally ill to protect him.
sentences.chinese: 她和丈夫說，楊家裝作兒子是精神病而包庇了他。

sentences.english: With the protection of law enforcement officials, counterfeiters will be more reckless.
sentences.chinese: 由於執法方面的包庇，造假者更加肆無忌憚。

sentences.english: He lied to the court to shield his friend.
sentences.chinese: 他對法庭說謊以包庇自己的朋友。

definition: to shield (a miscreant) from punishment, criticism etc/to take sb's side
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
to bend the law in order to favor one's relatives or associates (idiom)
to expose/to bring to light/to disclose/revelation
to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
to know the law and break it (idiom); consciously going against the rules
to collude with/to collaborate with/to gang up with
variant of 污衊|污蔑[wu1 mie4]
